title: JSON Schema for OTel recipe files

id.description: The unique identifier of the sample app. E.g. console, webapp, rest-api

languageId.description: The unique identifier of the programming language. MUST be one of the suggested by the schema

signal.description: The unique identifier of the telemetry signal. MUST be one of the suggested by the schema

displayName.description: The user friendly name of the sample app. This is shown on the website (filters)

description.description: A brief description of the sample app. This is shown in the 'sample metadata' section on the website

tags.description: Related tags with the language/technology of the recipe.

sourceRoot.description: The URL to the root directory of the sample app on GitHub. It's best to use a link with a ref to a tag/release version instead of using 'main'

steps.description: The list steps necessary to configure OpenTelemetry for the sample

dependencies.description: The list of dependencies (packages) necessary to configure OpenTelemetry for the sample

displayName.description: The user friendly name of the step. This is shown on the website in the list of steps to follow. E.g. Configure the exporter, Configure the Trace Provider

description.description: A brief description of the step

order.description: The order in which this step should appear in the list. Starting with 1 for the first step

source.description: The raw URL (raw.githubusercontent.com) to the file in the sample app that contains the code for this step. It's best to use a link with a ref to a tag/release version instead of using 'main'

required.description: Indicates if this step is mandatory for the user or not

id.description: The identifier of the dependency/package the user needs to install

version.description: The version of the depedency/package required for the sample
